alert.note: Alert for Sampson; Wayne (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 09 at 10:09PM EDT until July 10 at 12:15AM EDT by NWS Raleigh
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 115 AM EDT SUNDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of central North Carolina, including the following counties, Cumberland, Hoke, Johnston, Sampson and Wayne. * WHEN...Until 115 AM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1009 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between one half inch and 2 inches of rain has fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Fayetteville, Goldsboro, Clinton, Raeford, Mount Olive, Fort Bragg, Walnut Creek, Harrells, Godwin, Pope AFB, Antioch, Hope Mills, Spring Lake, Eastover, Roseboro, Stedman, Pikeville, Garland, Newton Grove and Wade. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
